title: Drawing, "Design for a Painted Porcelain Sugar Bowl and Stand, for Sèvres Porcelain Manufactury", ca. 1775
medium: Brush and watercolor, gray wash on cream laid paper
markings: Stamp:  Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration in black, lower right verso:  Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink across lower edge:  N° 11.  Sucrier tenant au plateau, dit de M. Le premier 54". [N° 11. Sugar bowl on a stand, called M. Le premier 54. (pouce?)] ; in graphite, upper right corner:  10; lower right corner, verso, sideways:  P.15.
provenance:
Giovanni Piancastelli
Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: An oval covered sugar bowl with gold knop and matching oval stand.  Rim of cover and stand are painted with scalloped band in gold inside of which is a thin blue band. The body of cover, bowl and inside of stand are painted with floral sprays of yellow and deep pink roses, blue ranuculusses/daisies, and yellow tulips.
